source_sentence: 大唐三藏菩提流志奉　詔譯
translation: translated by imperial edict of the Great Tang Tripitaka Master Bodhiruci奉

source_sentence: 勝鬘夫人會第四十八
translation: The Forty-eighth Assembly of the Lady Śrīmālā

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時憍薩羅波斯匿王及末利夫人初證法已，共相謂言：「我女勝鬘！
translation: When King Kassapa and Lady Māra first realized the teaching, they all said to each other, My daughter Śrīmālā!

source_sentence: 慈晤聰愍多聞智慧，若見如來，於甚深法速能解了無諸疑惑。
translation: If they see the Tathāgata, they'll quickly understand the profound teaching and have no doubts or doubts about it.

source_sentence: 我今應當令善諭者發其誠信。」
translation: Now, I should cause those who are well-advised to give rise to faith.

source_sentence: 作是議已，王及夫人即便作書，稱揚如來真實功德。
translation: After they had this discussion, the king and his wife wrote a letter praising the Tathāgata's true merit.

source_sentence: 時遣一使名真提羅，奉持王書詣無鬪城授勝鬘夫人。
translation: He then sent an envoy named Zentiluo, who carried the king's letter to the city of Wuqi and gave it to Lady Śrīmālā.

source_sentence: 「我聞如來聲，　　世間頗難遇，
translation: “I hear the voice of the Buddha, Which is hard to find in the world.

source_sentence: 斯言若真實，　　當賜汝衣服。
translation: If these words are true, you'll be given your clothes.

source_sentence: 若彼佛世尊，　　為利世間現，
translation: If those buddhas, world-honored ones, appeared for the sake of benefiting the world,

source_sentence: 必應見哀愍，　　令我覩真相。」
translation: You must have pity for me and allow me to see the truth.

source_sentence: 言念須臾頃，　　佛於虛空中，
translation: In a moment of thought, the Buddha flew in space.

source_sentence: 現不思議身，　　普放大光明。
translation: Manifesting inconceivable bodies, They radiate great light everywhere.

source_sentence: 勝鬘及眷屬，　　皆悉來集會，
translation: Vaiśravaṇa and his retinue Have all come to this assembly.

source_sentence: 合掌瞻仰禮，　　稱讚大導師：
translation: He joined his palms in respect and veneration, Praised the great Guide,

source_sentence: 「如來妙色身，　　世間無與等，
translation: The Tathāgata’s body of marvelous form Is unequaled in the world.

source_sentence: 無比不思議，　　是故今敬禮。
translation: incomparable and inconceivable, That is why I now venerate him.

source_sentence: 如來色無盡，　　智慧亦復然，
translation: The form of the Buddha is inexhaustible, So is his knowledge.

source_sentence: 一切法常住，　　是故我歸依。
translation: All things always abide; Therefore I take refuge in them.

source_sentence: 善調心過惡，　　及與身四種，
translation: Good absorption, bad absorption, and bad abhiñāpti are of four types:

source_sentence: 到不思議地，　　故我今敬禮。
translation: Having arrived at the inconceivable state, I now venerate it.

source_sentence: 知諸爾炎法，　　智身無罣礙，
translation: Knowing the principles of this kind of blazing, The body of knowledge is unobstructed.

source_sentence: 於法無忘失，　　故我今敬禮。
translation: Because they have no forgetfulness regarding the Dharma, I now venerate them.

source_sentence: 稽首過稱量，　　稽首無倫等，
translation: They bowed their heads in disrespect and reverence, And bowed their heads to the unworthy.

source_sentence: 稽首法自在，　　稽首超思惟。
translation: He bowed his head at the Dharma sovereignty, bowed his head and transcended contemplation.

source_sentence: 哀愍覆護我，　　令法種增長，
translation: Being compassionate, they protect me and cause the seeds of the Dharma to grow.

source_sentence: 逮及最後身，　　常在如來前。
translation: He's always in front of the Tathāgata when he acquires his final body.

source_sentence: 我所修福業，　　此世及餘生，
translation: I cultivate meritorious deeds in this world and the other beings.

source_sentence: 由斯善根力，　　願佛恒攝受。」
translation: Because of the power of these good roots, may the Buddha always take them in.

source_sentence: 時勝鬘夫人發書尋繹，頂受忻慶生希有心，向真提羅而說偈言：時勝鬘夫人說此偈已，
translation: The queen of Vaiśeṣika then wrote a letter inquiring into the matter and, feeling delighted at heart, said to Cundaka, “The queen of Vaiśeṣika has already composed these verses.

source_sentence: 及諸眷屬一切大眾，頂禮佛足。
translation: All the members of the assembly bowed their heads at the Buddha’s feet.

source_sentence: 「我昔為菩提，　　曾已開示汝，
translation: In the past I revealed enlightenment To you,

source_sentence: 今復值遇我，　　及來世亦然。」
translation: Now that you've met me again, it's likewise in the future.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊即為勝鬘而說偈言：說此偈已，即於會中授勝鬘夫人阿耨多羅三藐三菩提記：「汝今稱歎如來殊勝功德，
translation: It was then that the Bhagavat spoke these verses for Śrīmālā, saying: Having uttered these verses, you have now given the assurance of unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment to Lady Śrīmālā in the assembly.

source_sentence: 以此善根，當於無量阿僧祇劫天人之中為自在王，諸所受用皆悉具足，
translation: Because of these roots of goodness they will be sovereign kings among the gods and goddesses for immeasurable, incalculable aeons, enjoying all their benefits.

source_sentence: 所生之處常得遇我，現前稱歎如今無異。
translation: Wherever they are born, they'll always meet me, and I'll praise them in the present without any difference.

source_sentence: 復當供養無量無數諸佛世尊，過二萬阿僧祇劫當得作佛，號曰普光如來、應、正等覺。
translation: You will also pay homage to the innumerable and countless buddha world-honored ones, and after twenty thousand incalculable eons you will become a buddha named Samantabhadra Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One.

source_sentence: 彼佛國土無諸惡趣衰老病苦，亦無不善惡業道名。
translation: That Buddha land has no bad destinies, no decline, old age, illness, or suffering, and no unwholesome paths of action.

source_sentence: 其中眾生形色端嚴，具五妙境純受快樂，蔽於他化自在諸天。
translation: The sentient beings there are beautiful in form and appearance, endowed with five marvelous objects that purely bring happiness, and they shield themselves from the other-transformation self-contained gods.

source_sentence: 彼諸眾生皆趣大乘，諸有如是學大乘者悉來生彼。」
translation: Those sentient beings all aspire to the great vehicle, and those who thus train in the great vehicle will all come to be born there.

source_sentence: 時勝鬘夫人得授記已，無量天人心懷踊躍，咸願往生彼佛世界。
translation: When Lady Vaiśravaṇa had received the prediction, measureless gods cheered and jumped for joy, wishing to be reborn in that Buddha's world.

source_sentence: 是時世尊皆與授記當生彼國。
translation: The Bhagavān then gave them all the prediction that they'll be born in that country.

source_sentence: 時勝鬘夫人聞佛記已，於如來前合掌而立，發十弘誓，作如是言：「世尊！
translation: After hearing the Buddha's assurance, Lady Vaiśravaṇa stood before the Tathāgata with her palms pressed together and made ten great vows, saying, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我從今日乃至菩提，於諸受戒不起犯心。
translation: From today until my enlightenment, I won't violate the precepts in those who receive them.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我從今日乃至菩提，於諸師長不起慢心。
translation: From today until my enlightenment, I won't become conceited with respect to teachers and elders.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我從今日乃至菩提，於諸眾生不起恚心。
translation: From today until my enlightenment, I won't become angry with sentient beings.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我從今日乃至菩提，於諸勝已及諸勝事不起妬心。
translation: From today until my enlightenment, I won't become jealous of the excellences or the excellences.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我從今日乃至菩提，雖有少食不起慳心。
translation: From today until my enlightenment, even though I have a little food, I won't become stingy.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我從今日乃至菩提，不自為己受畜財物，凡有所受為濟貧苦有情之類。
translation: From today until my enlightenment, I won't accept the possessions for myself, and whatever I receive to help poor and suffering sentient beings.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我從今日乃至菩提，不求恩報行四攝事，無貪利心、無厭足心、無限礙心，
translation: From today until my enlightenment, without seeking reward or repayment for kindness, I practice the four principles of equanimity. My mind is not greedy, not satisfied, and free from boundless hindrances.

source_sentence: 攝受眾生。
translation: They take in sentient beings.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我從今日乃至菩提，見諸眾生無有依怙，幽繫疾惱種種危厄，終不捨離必願安隱，
translation: From today until I attain enlightenment, I see that all sentient beings have no support and are bound to various dangers and afflictions.

source_sentence: 以善饒益令免眾苦。
translation: They are well-benefiting so that they'll be freed from all suffering.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我從今日乃至菩提，若見一切諸惡律儀，毀犯如來清淨禁戒，凡我所攝城邑聚落，
translation: From today until I attain enlightenment, if I see all the bad forms of discipline and violate the pure precepts of the Tathāgata’s pure forbearance, wherever there are cities, towns, villages, and monasteries that I embrace,

source_sentence: 應調伏者而調伏之，應攝受者而攝受之。
translation: Those who should be disciplined are disciplined, and those who should be collected are collected.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 以調伏攝受故則正法久住，正法久住故天人充滿惡道減少，能令如來法輪常轉。
translation: Because they are subdued and collected, the right teaching abides for a long time, and because the right teaching abides for a long time, gods and humans fill bad destinies and decrease in number, which can cause the Tathāgata's Dharma wheel to always turn.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我從今日乃至菩提，攝受正法終不忘失。
translation: From today until my enlightenment, I'll collect the right teaching and never forget it.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 忘失正法則忘大乘，忘大乘者則忘波羅蜜，忘波羅蜜者則捨大乘。
translation: When they forget the right teaching, they forget the great vehicle; when they forget the great vehicle, they forget the pāramitā; and when they forget the pāramitā, they abandon the great vehicle.

source_sentence: 若諸菩薩有於大乘不決定者，攝受正法則不堅固，便不堪任超凡夫境，
translation: If enlightening beings have indeterminate conceptions regarding the Great Vehicle, they will not be able to embrace the true teaching. They will not be firm and unable to transcend the realm of worldlings.

source_sentence: 則為大失。
translation: That's a great mistake.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 現在未來攝受正法諸菩薩等，具足無邊廣大利益。
translation: In the present and future, bodhisattvas who take in the right teaching will be endowed with limitless and vast benefits.

source_sentence: 發斯弘誓，聖主世尊雖復證知，而諸有情善根微薄或起疑網，以十弘誓難成就故。
translation: Even though the noble lord Bhagavān has realized this great vow, some sentient beings with weak good roots sometimes give rise to webs of doubt because it's difficult to fulfill the ten great vows.

source_sentence: 彼或長夜習不善法受諸苦惱，為欲利益如斯眾生，今於佛前發誠實誓。
translation: For a long time, they may have cultivated unwholesome dharmas and suffered suffering and distress, but in order to benefit such sentient beings, they now make a sincere vow before the Buddha.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我今發此十弘誓願，若實不虛，於大眾上當雨天花出天妙音。」
translation: Now, I've made these ten great vows, and if they are true and not false, heavenly flowers will rain down on the masses and produce a marvelous sound of heavenly music.

source_sentence: 勝鬘夫人於如來前作斯言已，時虛空中即雨天花出天妙音，歎言：「善哉勝鬘夫人！
translation: After she said these words before the Tathāgata, Lady Śrīmālā rained heavenly flowers from the sky and produced a wonderful sound in heavenly voice, exclaiming, Good, lady Śrīmālā!

source_sentence: 如汝所說真實無異。」
translation: As you say, there's no difference in reality.

source_sentence: 爾時眾會既覩斯瑞，無諸疑惑生大歡喜，同聲唱言：「願與勝鬘夫人所生之處同其願行。」
translation: When the assembled people saw this miraculous vision, they had no doubts and became greatly joyous, and they all called out with one voice, May you be born in the same place as she wished.

source_sentence: 時佛世尊悉記大眾如其所願。
translation: The Bhagavān then remembered all the wishes of the masses.

source_sentence: 爾時勝鬘夫人復於佛前發三弘願：「以茲願力利益無邊諸有情類。
translation: It was then that Lady Śrīmālā again made three great vows before the Buddha, Using the power of this vow to benefit limitless sentient beings.

source_sentence: 第一願者，以我善根，於一切生得正法智。
translation: The first vow is to use my good roots to attain the knowledge of the right teaching in all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 第二願者，若我所生得正智已，為諸眾生演說無倦。
translation: The second vow is that if I have attained right knowledge produced by self, I will explain it to sentient beings without weariness.

source_sentence: 第三願者，我為攝受護持正法，於所生身不惜軀命。」
translation: The third vow is for the sake of taking in and upholding the right teaching, so that I won't spare my body or life for the body that's produced.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊聞斯願已，告勝鬘言：「如一切色悉入空界，如是菩薩恒沙諸願悉入茲願，
translation: After hearing these vows, the Bhagavān addressed Śrīmālā, saying, Just as all forms enter into space, so do these vows of the bodhisattva's eternal sands enter into this vow.

source_sentence: 此三願者真實廣大。」
translation: These three vows are truly vast.

source_sentence: 爾時勝鬘夫人復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that Lady Vaiśravaṇa again said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今當承佛威神辯才之力，欲說大願，幸垂聽許。」
translation: Now, thanks to the Buddha's authoritative power of his eloquence, I want to explain my great vow, so please allow me to do so.

source_sentence: 佛言：「勝鬘！
translation: The Buddha said, Vaiśravaṇa!

source_sentence: 恣汝所說。」
translation: I'll do as you say.

source_sentence: 勝鬘夫人言：「菩薩所有恒沙諸願，一切皆入一大願中。
translation: Lady Śrīmālā said, All the vows of the bodhisattva's constant sands enter into one great vow.

source_sentence: 一大願者，所謂攝受如來正法。
translation: A great vow is called taking in the Tathāgata's right teaching.

source_sentence: 如是攝受正法，真實廣大。」
translation: Thus, the right teaching that's collected is truly vast.

source_sentence: 佛言：「善哉勝鬘！
translation: The Buddha said, Good, Śrīmālā!

source_sentence: 汝久修習，智慧方便甚深微妙。
translation: You've cultivated it for a long time, and its wisdom and skillful means are profound and subtle.

source_sentence: 有能解了汝所說義，彼於長夜植諸善本。
translation: If someone understands the meaning of what you teach, they'll plant good roots for a long time.

source_sentence: 如汝所說攝受正法，皆是過去未來現在諸佛已說今說當說。
translation: As you say, the right teaching of taking in sentient beings is that they've all been taught and will be taught by past, future, and present buddhas.

source_sentence: 我得無上正等菩提，亦復常以種種相說攝受正法，如是稱揚攝受正法，
translation: I attain unexcelled true and complete enlightenment, always expounding the appropriated doctrine in various ways.

source_sentence: 所有功德無有邊際，如來智慧亦無邊際。
translation: There's no limit to the merit that exists, and the Tathāgata's wisdom has no limit.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 是攝受正法有大功德、有大利益。」
translation: This is the great merit and great benefit of gathering in the right teaching.

source_sentence: 時勝鬘夫人復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Lady Śrīmālā then again said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我當承佛威神之力，更復演說攝受正法廣大之義。」
translation: By relying on the Buddha's authoritative power, I will further explain the vast meaning of gathering in the right teaching.

source_sentence: 佛言：「聽汝所說。」
translation: The Buddha said, Listen to what you say.

source_sentence: 勝鬘夫人言：「攝受正法廣大義者，為得無量一切佛法，乃至能攝八萬行蘊。
translation: Lady Śrīmālā said, To gather the vast meaning of the right teaching is to attain measureless all the buddha-teachings, up to 80,000 practices that can be collected.

source_sentence: 譬如劫初興諸色雲雨眾寶雨，如是攝受正法善根之雲，能雨無量福報之雨。
translation: It's like the cloud of form that arises at the beginning of an eon and rains down the rain of many treasures, thus gathering in the cloud of good roots of the right teaching, which can rain down measureless rain of merit.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 又如劫初大水之中，能生三千大千界藏及四百億種種類洲。
translation: It's also like the great water at the beginning of an eon that produces 3,000 great one-thousand world stores and four hundred million kinds of continents.

source_sentence: 如是攝受正法，出生大乘無量界藏，并諸菩薩神通之力、種種法門，一切世間及出世間安樂具足，
translation: Thus taking in the true teaching, they produce the great vehicle storehouse of immeasurable worlds, as well as the spiritual powers and various dharmas of enlightening beings, which bring peace and comfort to all worlds and beyond.

source_sentence: 一切天人所未曾有。
translation: It's unprecedented to all gods and humans.

source_sentence: 又如大地荷四重擔。
translation: It's also like the great earth that carries four heavy burdens.

source_sentence: 何等為四？
translation: What are these four?

source_sentence: 一者大海，二者諸山，三者草木，四者眾生。
translation: One is the great ocean, two are the mountains, three are grass and trees, and four are sentient beings.

source_sentence: 如是攝受正法諸善男子及善女人，堪能荷負四種重任逾彼大地。
translation: Thus, these good men and good women who take in the right teaching are capable of carrying four kinds of heavy burdens that can be carried beyond the earth.

source_sentence: 何等為四？
translation: What are these four?

source_sentence: 謂離善友無聞非法，諸有情類以人天善根而成熟之，求聲聞者授聲聞乘，
translation: It means to be free of good friends and not hearing what’s unlawful, to mature sentient beings with the good roots of humans and gods, and to teach the vehicle of śrāvakas to those who seek śrāvakahood.

source_sentence: 求獨覺者授獨覺乘，求大乘者授以大乘。
translation: Those who seek the solitary realizer teach the solitary realizer vehicle, and those who seek the great vehicle teach the great vehicle.

source_sentence: 是名攝受正法諸善男子及善女人，堪能荷負四種重任逾彼大地。
translation: These are called good men and good women who take in the right teaching and are capable of carrying four kinds of heavy burdens beyond that great earth.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如是攝受正法善男子善女人等建立大地，堪能荷負四種重任，普為眾生作不請友，
translation: Good men and good women who embraced the true teaching thus established a great land, capable of bearing the burden of the four kinds of heavy responsibilities, and became uninvited friends for all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 大悲利益哀愍有情為世法母。
translation: Great compassion, benefiting sentient beings with pity, is the mother of the Dharma in the world.

source_sentence: 又如大地是四種寶所生之處。
translation: It's also like the great earth, which is the place where four kinds of treasures are produced.

source_sentence: 何等為四？
translation: What are these four?

source_sentence: 一者無價，二者上價，三者中價，四者下價。
translation: One is priceless, two are superior, three are middling, and four are inferior.

source_sentence: 如是攝受正法善男子善女人建立大地，有情遇已獲四大寶，一切寶中最為殊勝。
translation: Good men and good women who thus take in the right teaching establish a great ground, and when sentient beings meet it, they attain the four great treasures, which are the most distinguished among all the treasures.

source_sentence: 何等為四？
translation: What are these four?

source_sentence: 謂諸有情遇斯善友，或有獲得人天善根，有證聲聞及辟支佛或無上乘善根功德。
translation: It means that when sentient beings meet such a good friend, some attain the good roots of humans and gods, and some realize the merit of the good roots of śrāvakas, pratyekbuddhas, or the unsurpassed vehicle.

source_sentence: 是名攝受正法善男子善女人建立大地，有情遇已便能獲得四種大寶。
translation: These are called the four great treasures of gathering in the right teaching, good men and good women establishing a great ground, and when sentient beings meet them, they'll be able to attain these four kinds.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 出大寶者，名為真實攝受正法。
translation: The one who produces the great treasure is called the true taking in of the right teaching.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 言攝受正法者，謂無異正法、無異攝受正法，正法即是攝受正法。
translation: The expression taking in the right teaching means that there's no different right teaching or right teaching that takes in the right teaching without difference, and right teaching is the right teaching that takes in the right teaching without difference.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 無異波羅蜜、無異攝受正法，攝受正法即是波羅蜜多。
translation: The absence of different perfections and the absence of different ways to gather the right teaching, and the taking in of the right teaching are the perfections.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 攝受正法善男子善女人，應以施成熟者以施成熟，乃至捨身隨順彼意而成熟之，
translation: Good men and good women who embrace the right teaching should be matured by giving to those who are matured by giving, up to the point where they're matured by abandoning their bodies and following their thoughts.

source_sentence: 令彼有情安住正法，是名施波羅蜜。
translation: Causing those sentient beings to abide in the right teaching is called the perfection of generosity.

source_sentence: 應以戒成熟者，守護六根淨身語意乃至威儀，隨順彼意而成熟之，令彼有情安住正法，
translation: Those who are disciplined by the precepts should guard the six faculties, purifying body, speech, and mind, up to their manner of behavior, and develop them according to their wishes, enabling those sentient beings to abide in the true teaching.

source_sentence: 是名戒波羅蜜。
translation: This is called the perfection of morality.

source_sentence: 應以忍成熟者，若彼有情罵詈毀辱誹謗擾亂，以無恚心及利益心最上忍力，
translation: Those who should be matured by forbearance—if those sentient beings scold, abuse, disparage, and disturb others, use the power of the supreme forbearance of a mind free from hatred and benefiting others.

source_sentence: 乃至顏色亦不變異，隨順彼意而成熟之，令彼有情安住正法，是名忍波羅蜜。
translation: Up to the point where their appearance doesn't change, they follow their minds and ripen them, causing sentient beings to abide in the right teaching, which is called the perfection of forbearance.

source_sentence: 應以精進而成熟者，於彼有情不起懈怠下劣之心，起大樂欲最上精進，
translation: Those who should be matured by means of energy don’t give rise to lazy or inferior thoughts about those sentient beings, and give rise to great joy and desire for the supreme effort.

source_sentence: 於四威儀隨順彼意而成熟之，令彼有情安住正法，是名精進波羅蜜。
translation: ripening them according to their wishes in the four ways they behave, and causing those sentient beings to abide in the right teaching is called the perfection of effort.

source_sentence: 應以靜慮而成熟者，於彼有情以無散亂成就正念，曾所作事終不忘失，
translation: Those who should be matured by means of meditation develop right mindfulness without distraction toward those sentient beings, never forgetting what they’ve done.

source_sentence: 隨順彼意而成熟之，令彼有情安住正法，是名靜慮波羅蜜。
translation: To follow their thoughts and ripen them so that sentient beings will abide in the right teaching is called the perfection of meditation.

source_sentence: 應以智慧而成熟者，彼諸有情為利益故問諸法義，以無倦心而為演說一切諸論、一切明處乃至種種工巧之處，
translation: Those who are to be matured by means of wisdom should, for the benefit of sentient beings, ask about the meaning of the teachings and, with an unremitting mind, explain all kinds of doctrines, all kinds of explanations, and all kinds of skillful means.

source_sentence: 令得究竟隨順彼意而成熟之，令彼有情安住正法，是名智慧波羅蜜。
translation: Causing them to attain the ultimate maturation of following their thoughts and causing those sentient beings to abide in the right teaching is called the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 是故世尊！
translation: Therefore, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 無異波羅蜜、無異攝受正法，攝受正法即是波羅蜜。」
translation: The absence of dissimilarity in the perfection and the absence of dissimilarity in taking in the right teaching are the perfections, and taking in the right teaching is the perfection.

source_sentence: 時勝鬘夫人復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Lady Śrīmālā then again said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我今承佛威神辯才之力，復說大義。」
translation: Now, by the power of the Buddha's authoritative eloquence, I'll explain the great meaning again.

source_sentence: 佛言：「云何大義？」
translation: The Buddha said, What's the great meaning?

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 攝受正法者、無異攝受正法。
translation: He who collects the right teaching and doesn't differently collect the right teaching.

source_sentence: 無異攝受正法者，攝受正法善男子善女人，則是攝受正法。
translation: It's no different from taking in the right teaching, which is to take in good men and good women who take in the right teaching, which is to take in the right teaching.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 若攝受正法善男子善女人，為正法故捨身命財，如是人等以捨身故，證生死後際遠離老病得不壞常，
translation: Good men and good women who embrace the right teaching and give up their bodies, life, and property for the sake of the right teaching. Because they give up their bodies, such people realize that at the end of birth and death they are freed from old age, illness, and attaining unbreakable permanence.

source_sentence: 無有變易究竟寂靜不可思議如來法身。
translation: There's no change in the ultimate quiescence and inconceivability of the Tathāgata's Dharma body.

source_sentence: 以捨命故，證生死後際永離於死得無邊常，成就不可思議諸善功德，安住一切佛法神變。
translation: Because of their abandonment of life, they realize that the end of birth and death is permanently separated from death and attains boundless permanence, accomplish inconceivable good qualities, and abide in all the Buddha's miraculous transformations of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 以捨財故，證生死後際超過有情無盡無減果報圓滿，具不思議功德莊嚴，
translation: Because of giving up their possessions, they realize the inconceivable realization of birth and death beyond sentient beings at the end of life. Their fruitful rewards are inexhaustible and undiminishing, fully adorned with inconceivable virtues.

source_sentence: 為諸有情尊重供養。
translation: They are honored and offered support to sentient beings.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 捨身命財攝受正法善男子善女人等，為諸如來之所授記。
translation: They abandon their body, life, possessions, and property to gather in the right Dharma, good men and good women, and so forth, are given assurance by the Tathāgatas.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若善男子善女人，正法欲滅，有諸比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷，互相朋黨起諸諍訟，
translation: If there are good men and good women who want to extinguish the right teaching, if there are monks, bhikṣuṇīs, laymen, and laywomen who become friends with each other and give rise to arguments.

source_sentence: 以不諂曲不欺誑心，愛樂正法攝受正法入善朋中。
translation: With a mind that's not flattering or deceptive, they love the right teaching and take in the right teaching to enter into good friends.

source_sentence: 入善朋者，必為諸佛之所授記。
translation: Those who enter good friends will surely receive the prediction of enlightenment from the buddhas.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我見攝受正法有斯大力，如來以此為眼、為法根本，為引導法、為通達法。」
translation: I see that there's such great power to gather in the right teaching, which is the eye of the Tathāgata, the root of the teaching, the guide of the teaching, and the master of the teaching.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊聞勝鬘夫人所說攝受正法有大威力，歎言：「如是如是。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān heard what Lady Śrīmālā said about taking in the right teaching with great authority and praised it, saying, So it is.

source_sentence: 善哉勝鬘！
translation: Excellent, Vaiśravaṇa!

source_sentence: 如汝所說，攝受正法大威德力。
translation: As you say, it's the great authoritative power of gathering in the right teaching.

source_sentence: 如大力士微觸末摩，生大苦痛更增重病。
translation: It's like when a great man of great strength subtly touches the powdered mud and produces great pain and increased illness.

source_sentence: 如是勝鬘！
translation: So it is, Vaiśravaṇa!

source_sentence: 假令少分攝受正法，令魔波旬痛切愁惱悲號歎息，亦復如是。
translation: Suppose someone were to partially embrace the right teaching and cause Māra Pāpīyān's pain, grief, sorrow, lamentation, and screaming to cease, it would be likewise.

source_sentence: 勝鬘！
translation: Vaiśravaṇa!

source_sentence: 我常不見餘一善法令魔愁惱，猶如少分攝受正法。
translation: I always don't see another good decree that causes Māra to grieve, just like taking in a small part of the right teaching.

source_sentence: 勝鬘！
translation: Vaiśravaṇa!

source_sentence: 譬如牛王形色端正，身量殊特蔽於諸牛。
translation: It's like the shape and color of a king cow, whose body is so different in size that it especially shields the cows.

source_sentence: 如是勝鬘！
translation: So it is, Vaiśravaṇa!

source_sentence: 修大乘者設令少分攝受正法，即能蔽於聲聞獨覺一切善法。
translation: If someone cultivates the great vehicle and causes them to partially accept the right teaching, they'll be able to shield themselves from all the good qualities of śrāvakas and solitary realizers.

source_sentence: 勝鬘！
translation: Vaiśravaṇa!

source_sentence: 又如須彌山王高廣嚴麗蔽於眾山。
translation: It's also like Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, which is so lofty and beautiful that it covers all the mountains.

source_sentence: 如是勝鬘！
translation: So it is, Vaiśravaṇa!

source_sentence: 初趣大乘以饒益心不顧身命攝受正法，便能超過顧其身命久住大乘一切善根。
translation: When someone first enters the great vehicle, they take in the right teaching with a mind that benefits and doesn't care about body and life, and then they can transcend looking after their body and life and long-abiding great vehicle wholesome roots.

source_sentence: 是故勝鬘！
translation: Therefore, Vaiśravaṇa!

source_sentence: 當以攝受正法開示教化一切有情。
translation: You should take in the right teaching and teach it to all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 如是勝鬘！
translation: So it is, Vaiśravaṇa!

source_sentence: 攝受正法獲大福利及大果報。
translation: They'll gather in the right teaching and attain great benefits and great rewards.

source_sentence: 勝鬘！
translation: Vaiśravaṇa!

source_sentence: 我於無數阿僧祇劫稱讚如是攝受正法所有功德，不得邊際，是故攝受正法成就如是無量功德。」
translation: For countless incalculably long eons, I praised the merit of thus collecting the right teaching and attained it, but I couldn't reach the limit; therefore, I collected the right teaching and accomplished such measureless merit.

source_sentence: 佛告勝鬘：「汝今復應演我所說攝受正法，一切諸佛共所愛樂。」
translation: The Buddha told Śrīmālā, Now, you should also explain what I teach to gather in the right teaching that's shared by all the buddhas and beloved by all of them.

source_sentence: 勝鬘白言：「善哉世尊！
translation: Śrīmālā said, Good, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 攝受正法者則名大乘。
translation: Those who gather the right teaching are called the great vehicle.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 大乘者出生一切聲聞獨覺、世出世間所有善法。
translation: The great vehicle produces all the good qualities of śrāvakas, pratyekbuddhas, and worldly and supramundane dharmas.

source_sentence: 如阿耨達池出八大河，如是大乘出生一切聲聞獨覺、世出世間所有善法。
translation: Just as the Anavatapta Lake produces eight great rivers, so does the great vehicle give rise to all the good qualities of śrāvakas, pratyekbuddhas, and worldly and supramundane beings who are born in the great vehicle.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 又如一切種子草木叢林，皆依大地而得生長。
translation: It's also like all the seeds, grass, trees, shrubs, and forests that grow based on the earth.

source_sentence: 如是一切聲聞獨覺、世出世間所有善法，皆依大乘而得生長。
translation: Thus, all the good qualities of all śrāvakas, pratyekbuddhas, and worldly and supramundane people can grow based on the great vehicle.

source_sentence: 是故世尊！
translation: Therefore, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 住於大乘攝受大乘，即住攝受聲聞獨覺、世出世間所有善法。
translation: He abides in the great vehicle and collects the great vehicle, which is to say, he abides in collecting the good qualities of śrāvakas, pratyekbuddhas, and worldly and supramundane dharmas.

source_sentence: 如佛世尊所說六處，謂正法住、正法滅、別解脫、毘奈耶、正出家、受具足，
translation: The Buddha, the World-honored One, has been speaking of six kinds of existence: abiding in the true doctrine, the cessation of the true doctrine, individual liberation, restraint, renunciation, and endowment.

source_sentence: 為大乘故說此六處。
translation: It's because of the great vehicle that these six places are taught.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 正法住者為大乘說，大乘住者即正法住。
translation: Those who abide in the right teaching explain it for the great vehicle, and those who abide in the great vehicle are those who abide in the right teaching.

source_sentence: 正法滅者為大乘說，大乘滅者即正法滅。
translation: The cessation of the right teaching is explained for the great vehicle, and the cessation of the great vehicle is the cessation of the right teaching.

source_sentence: 別解脫、毘奈耶，此之二法義一名異。
translation: Distinct liberation and vinaya, the meaning of these two dharmas are one and the same.

source_sentence: 毘奈耶者即大乘學。
translation: Vaiśravaṇa is the great vehicle training.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 為佛出家而受具足，是故大乘戒蘊是毘奈耶，是正出家是受具足。
translation: It's because the Buddha leaves home and receives the full set of precepts, so the great vehicle morality aggregate is the vinaya, which means that rightly leaving home is the full set of precepts.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 阿羅漢者無有出家及受具足。
translation: An arhat is someone who doesn't leave home and receive the full ordination.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 阿羅漢不為如來出家受具足故。
translation: It's because an arhat doesn't leave home for the sake of the Tathāgata and receive the full set of precepts.

source_sentence: 阿羅漢有怖畏想，歸依如來。
translation: An arhat has fearful thoughts and takes refuge in the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 阿羅漢於一切行住怖畏想，如人執劍欲來害己，是故阿羅漢不證出離究竟安樂。
translation: An arhat's fearful conception of all actions is like a person holding a sword in their hand who wants to harm themselves, so an arhat doesn't realize liberation and ultimate peace.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 依不求依，如諸眾生無有歸依，彼彼恐怖，為安隱故求於歸依。
translation: Relying and not seeking a basis, it's like sentient beings who have no refuge, and they fear each other and seek refuge for the sake of peace.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如是阿羅漢有恐怖故歸依如來。
translation: Thus, an arhat has fear and therefore relies on the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 是故阿羅漢及辟支佛，生法有餘、梵行未立、所作未辦、當有所斷未究竟故，
translation: That is why arhats and pratyekabuddhas produce dharmas with remainder, because the practice of austerity has not been established, what should be done has not been done, something to be abandoned has not been perfected.

source_sentence: 去涅槃遠。
translation: It's far from nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 唯有如來、應、正等覺證得涅槃，成就無量不可思議一切功德，所應斷者皆悉已斷究竟清淨，
translation: Only the Buddha, the Arhat, and the Completely Awakened One alone will realize nirvana, perfecting immeasurable, inconceivable all virtues. All that should be eliminated are ultimately eliminated and completely purified.

source_sentence: 為諸有情之所瞻仰，超過二乘菩薩境界。
translation: They are admired by all sentient beings and transcend the realm of the bodhisattvas of the two vehicles.

source_sentence: 阿羅漢等則不如是，言得涅槃佛之方便，是故阿羅漢等去涅槃遠。
translation: The arhats and so forth are not like this, saying that they've attained nirvāṇa as the Buddha's skillful means, which is why the arhats and so forth are far removed from nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 世尊說阿羅漢及辟支佛，觀察解脫四智究竟得蘇息者，皆是如來隨他意語不了義說。
translation: The Bhagavān teaches that arhats and pratyekabuddhas who observe the four kinds of cognition of liberation and ultimately attain calmness are all taught by the Tathāgata in ways that don't understand their meaning according to the words of others.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 有二種死。
translation: There are two kinds of death:

source_sentence: 何等為二？
translation: What are these two?

source_sentence: 一者分段，二者變易。
translation: The first is fragmentation, and the second is change.

source_sentence: 分段死者，謂相續有情。
translation: segmental death refers to sentient beings in the stream.

source_sentence: 變易死者，謂阿羅漢及辟支佛、自在菩薩，隨意生身乃至菩提。
translation: Death by transmutation refers to arhats, pratyekabuddhas and self-dependent bodhisattvas who give rise to bodies as they wish up to enlightenment.

source_sentence: 二種死中，以分段死說阿羅漢及辟支佛，生於我生已盡之智。
translation: In the two kinds of death, it's said to be the arhat and pratyekabuddha in terms of segmental death, which give rise to the knowledge that self has been produced and ended.

source_sentence: 由能證得有餘果故，生於梵行已立之智，一切愚夫所不能作，七種學人未能成辦，
translation: Because they realize that there are other fruits, they give rise to knowledge established in the practice of celibacy, which all fools cannot do. Seven kinds of learners will not be able to accomplish it:

source_sentence: 相續煩惱究竟斷故，生於所作已辦之智。
translation: Because the successive defilements are ultimately abandoned, knowledge arises of what has already been done.

source_sentence: 世尊說生不受後有智者，謂阿羅漢及辟支佛不能斷於一切煩惱，不了一切受生之智。
translation: The World-honoured One said: “Birth is not subject to subsequent knowledge”: Because arhats and pratyekabuddhas are unable to abandon all the defilements and do not understand all the knowledge of rearising.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 是阿羅漢及辟支佛有餘煩惱不斷盡故，不能了知一切受生。
translation: Because these arhats and pratyekabuddhas have remaining afflictions that don't end, they can't know all births.

source_sentence: 煩惱有二，謂住地煩惱及起煩惱。
translation: Defilement is twofold: defilement of the stages of abiding and defilement of the one who produces.

source_sentence: 住地有四。
translation: There are four stages of abiding.

source_sentence: 何等為四？
translation: What are these four?

source_sentence: 謂見一處住地，欲愛住地，色愛住地，有愛住地。
translation: They are the stage of abiding in seeing one place, the stage of abiding in craving for desire, the stage of abiding in craving for form, and the stage of abiding in craving for existence.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此四住地，能生一切遍起煩惱。
translation: These four stages of abiding give rise to all the defilements that arise universally.

source_sentence: 起煩惱者，剎那剎那與心相應。
translation: Those who give rise to afflictions are moment-to-moment and moment-to-moment associated with mind.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 無明住地，無始時來心不相應。
translation: The sphere of nescience is not associated with mind since beginningless time.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 四住地力能作遍起煩惱所依，比無明地，算數譬喻所不能及。
translation: The power of the fourth abode is able to act as the support for all the defilements that arise. It cannot be compared with the power of calculation and analogy in the stage of ignorance.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如是無明住地，於有愛住地，其力最大。
translation: Thus, the entrenchment of nescience is the strongest among the entrenchments of craving.

source_sentence: 譬如魔王色力威德及眾眷屬，蔽於他化自在諸天。
translation: It's like the demon king's form, power, authoritativeness, and his retinues that obstruct the gods who are free to transform others.

source_sentence: 如是無明住地蔽四住地，過恒沙數煩惱所依，亦令四種煩惱久住。
translation: Thus, the four entrenchments of ignorance that obscure the four entrenchments and are the bases of afflictions beyond the number of constant sands also cause the four kinds of afflictions to abide for a long time.

source_sentence: 聲聞獨覺智不能斷，唯有如來智所能斷。
translation: The knowledge of śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas cannot eliminate it, but only the knowledge of the Tathāgata can eliminate it.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如是如是，無明住地其力最大。
translation: Thus and so forth, the entrenchment of nescience is the strongest.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如取為緣，有漏業因而生三有。
translation: The three existences arise as a result of impure action, in the same way that grasping is the supporting object.

source_sentence: 如是無明住地為緣，無漏業因能生阿羅漢及辟支佛、大力菩薩隨意生身。
translation: Thus, the entrenchment of ignorance is the condition as an uncontaminated karmic cause that gives rise to the body that arhats, pratyekabuddhas, and great bodhisattvas give rise to at will.

source_sentence: 此之三地隨意生身及無漏業，皆以無明住地為所依處。
translation: These three stages are the body that is spontaneous and pure action, all with ignorance as their support.

source_sentence: 彼雖有緣，亦能為緣。
translation: Even though they have perceptual objects, they can also be perceptual objects.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是故三種隨意生身及無漏業，皆以無明住地為緣，同於有愛。
translation: Because of this, the three kinds of bodily action that are produced spontaneously and pure action all take ignorance as supporting object:

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 有愛住地不與無明住地業同，無明住地異四住地。
translation: The entrenchment of craving is not the same as the entrenchment of ignorance with regard to action. The entrenchment of ignorance is different from the four other entrenchments.

source_sentence: 異四住地唯佛能斷。
translation: It's different from the four abodes in which only buddhas can stop it.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 阿羅漢辟支佛斷四住地，於漏盡力不得自在，不能現證。
translation: An arhat or pratyekabuddha stops the four entrenchments and doesn't attain mastery over the exhaustion of contaminants, so he can't realize them.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 世尊言漏盡之增語，是故阿羅漢辟支佛及最後有諸菩薩等，為無明地所覆蔽故，
translation: The World-honoured One said, “The impure influences are extinguished. This is why the arhats, pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas of the last existence are overwhelmed by ignorance”:

source_sentence: 於彼彼法不知不見。
translation: They don't know and don't see those things.

source_sentence: 以不知見於彼彼法，應斷不斷、應盡不盡。
translation: It's because they don't know and see these things, which should be stopped and not stopped or ended and not ended.

source_sentence: 於彼彼法不斷不盡故，得有餘解脫，非一切解脫；
translation: They attain liberation with remainder because they do so without stopping or extinguishing all those factors, not all liberation.

source_sentence: 得有餘清淨，非一切清淨；
translation: They attain purity with remainder, but they are not all pure.

source_sentence: 得有餘功德，非一切功德。
translation: The acquisition has other qualities that are not all qualities.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 以得有餘解脫非一切解脫，乃至有餘功德非一切功德故，知有餘苦、斷有餘集、證有餘滅、修有餘道。」
translation: It's because attaining liberation with remainder isn't all liberation, and even the virtues with remainder aren't all virtues, so they know that there's suffering with remainder, ending accumulation with remainder, realizing cessation with remainder, and cultivating the path with remainder.

source_sentence: 爾時勝鬘夫人復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that Lady Vaiśravaṇa again said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若復知有餘苦、斷有餘集、證有餘滅、修有餘道，是名少分滅度，證少分涅槃向涅槃界。
translation: If someone also knows that there's residual suffering, eliminates residual accumulation, realizes cessation with residual cessation, and cultivates the path with residual cessation, this is called partial liberation, and realizes partial nirvāṇa and heads toward the realm of nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 若知一切苦、斷一切集、證一切滅、修一切道，彼於無常敗壞世間得證常寂清涼涅槃。
translation: If someone knows all suffering, ends all accumulation, realizes all cessation, and cultivates all paths, they'll attain nirvāṇa of permanence, quiescence, and coolness in the world of impermanence and decay.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 彼於無護無依世間為護為依。
translation: In the world where there's no protection and no support, it's protection that's the basis.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 於諸法中見高下者不證涅槃，智平等者、解脫等者、清淨等者乃證涅槃。
translation: Those who see high and low in all dharmas don't realize nirvāṇa, but those whose knowledge is equal, liberated, etc., and pure are the ones who realize nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 是故涅槃名等一味。
translation: Therefore, nirvāṇa is called the same as one flavor.

source_sentence: 云何一味？
translation: What's the single flavor?

source_sentence: 謂解脫味。
translation: It's the taste of liberation.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若無明地不斷不盡，不得涅槃一味等味。
translation: If the state of nescience doesn't continue and doesn't end, they won't attain the single taste of nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 無明住地不斷不盡故，過恒沙等一切過法，應斷不斷、應盡不盡。
translation: Because the entrenchment of nescience doesn't stop and doesn't end, all the faults that go beyond the sands of the Ganges should be stopped and not ended.

source_sentence: 過恒沙等一切過法不斷不盡故，過恒沙等諸功德法不了不證。
translation: It's because all the faults like the sands of the Ganges are unceasing and inexhaustible, and the merits like the sands of the Ganges don't understand or realize them.

source_sentence: 是故無明住地與於一切所應斷法諸隨煩惱為生處故，從於彼生，障心煩惱、障止煩惱、障觀煩惱、障靜慮煩惱，
translation: Therefore, the entrenchment of ignorance and all the secondary passions that are to be abandoned as well as the abode of dharmas arise from these. They arise from there:

source_sentence: 如是乃至障三摩鉢底加行智果證力無畏。
translation: Thus, it's up to the realization of the power and fearlessness of the result of the knowledge of the afflictive samāpatti applied practices.

source_sentence: 所有過恒沙等一切煩惱，如來菩提、佛金剛智之所能斷。
translation: All the afflictions that exist beyond the sands of the Ganges can be stopped by the Tathāgata's enlightenment and Buddha's adamantine wisdom.

source_sentence: 諸起煩惱，一切皆依無明住地，無明住地為因緣故。
translation: All the defilements that arise are all based on the entrenchment of ignorance, because it is the cause and condition for the entrenchment of ignorance.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此起煩惱，剎那剎那與心相應。
translation: The arising of these defilements is moment by moment associated with awarenesses.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 無明住地從無始來心不相應。
translation: The entrenchment of nescience is not associated with the mind since beginningless time.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若復過恒河沙如來菩提、佛金剛智所應斷法，一切皆是無明住地依持建立。
translation: If it were to go beyond the Tathāgata's enlightenment and the buddha's adamantine wisdom that should be stopped, all of them would be based on the support and establishment of the entrenchment of ignorance.

source_sentence: 譬如一切種子叢林，皆依大地之所生長，若地壞者彼亦隨壞。
translation: It's like a forest of all seeds that rely on the earth to grow, and if the earth breaks down, they also break down along with it.

source_sentence: 如是過恒沙等如來菩提、佛金剛智所應斷法，一切皆依無明住地之所生長。
translation: Thus, there are more than an infinite number of such things that should be stopped by the Tathāgata's enlightenment and the Buddha's adamantine wisdom, and they all arise based on the ground where ignorance abides.

source_sentence: 若彼無明住地斷者，過恒沙等如來菩提、佛金剛智所應斷法，皆亦隨斷。
translation: If those in the abode of nescience are stopped, then they'll all be stopped along with the teachings that should be stopped by the Tathāgata's enlightenment and Buddha's adamantine wisdom, which are more numerous than the sands of the Ganges.

source_sentence: 如是過恒沙等所應斷法，一切煩惱及起煩惱皆已斷故，便能證得過恒沙等不可思議諸佛之法。
translation: Because all the afflictions and the afflictions that arise have been stopped, they'll then be able to realize the inconceivable buddha-dharmas like these that should be stopped beyond the number of sands of the Ganges, and so forth, and because they've stopped all the afflictions and afflictions that arise.

source_sentence: 於一切法而能證得無礙神通，得諸智見離一切過，得諸功德為大法王於法自在，
translation: In all things they can realize unhindered spiritual powers. Attaining knowledge and seeing, they are free of all faults. Attaining virtues, they are great kings of the Teaching, sovereigns over the Teaching.

source_sentence: 證一切法自在之地，正師子吼，我生已盡、梵行已立、所作已辦、不受後有。
translation: To realize the ground of mastery over all dharmas, he correctly roars the lion's roar, saying, 'My birth has ended, the religious practice has been established, what I've done has been done, and I won't be subject to future existence.'

source_sentence: 是故世尊以師子吼，依於了義一向記說。
translation: Therefore, the Bhagavān uses the lion's roar to rely on the fully explained meaning and always record it.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 不受後有智有二種。
translation: There are two kinds of cognition that aren't subject to subsequent existence.

source_sentence: 何謂為二？
translation: What are these two?

source_sentence: 一者謂諸如來以調御力摧伏四魔超諸世間，一切有情之所瞻仰；
translation: The first is that the enlightened ones subdue the four demons by means of the power of discipline, transcending all worlds, and are revered by all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 證不思議清淨法身，於所知地得法自在，最勝無上更無所作，不見更有所證之地；
translation: They realize the inconceivable body of truth, and at the stage of knowledge they attain unimpeded mastery over all phenomena. Theirs is supremely pure; there is nothing further to do.

source_sentence: 具足十力，登於最勝無畏之地，於一切法無礙觀察，正師子吼，不受後有。
translation: Replete with the ten powers, he ascends to the most excellent and fearless ground, observes all dharmas without obstruction, correctly roars the lion's roar, and doesn't accept future existence.

source_sentence: 二者謂阿羅漢及辟支佛，得度無量生死怖畏，受解脫樂，作如是念：『我今已離生死怖畏，
translation: The second is when arhats and pratyekabuddhas are liberated from the fear of birth-and-death, experience the bliss of liberation, and think, ‘Now that I am freed from the fear of birth-and-death,

source_sentence: 不受諸苦。』
translation: They won't experience suffering.'

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 阿羅漢辟支佛如是觀察謂不受後有，不證第一蘇息涅槃。
translation: An arhat or pratyekabuddha thus observes that they don't accept later existences and don't realize the first cessation of nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 彼等於未證地不遇法故，能自解了，我今證得有餘依地，決定當證阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: They are able to understand for themselves because they haven't yet realized the ground and don't encounter the Dharma, but now that I've realized the ground with remainder, I'm sure I'll realize unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 聲聞獨覺皆入大乘，而大乘者即是佛乘，是故三乘即是一乘，證一乘者得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，
translation: śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas all enter the great vehicle, but the great vehicle is the buddha vehicle. Therefore, the three vehicles are the one vehicle. Those who realize the one vehicle will attain highest, complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 阿耨多羅三藐三菩提者即是涅槃，言涅槃者即是如來清淨法身，證法身者即是一乘，
無異如來、無異法身。
translation: It's no different from the Tathāgata and no different from the Dharma body.

source_sentence: 言如來者即是法身，證究竟法身者即究竟一乘，究竟一乘者即離相續。
translation: When it's said that the Tathāgata is the Dharma body, realizing the ultimate Dharma body means the ultimate single vehicle, and the ultimate single vehicle means being free of continuity.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如來住時無有限量等於後際，如來能以無限大悲無限誓願利益世間，作是說者是名善說。
translation: When the Tathāgata abides, there are no limits and so forth at the end, and when he can explain it this way with infinite great compassion and infinite vows to benefit the world with infinite vows, this is called a good explanation.

source_sentence: 若復說言，如來是常、是無盡法、一切世間究竟依者，亦名善說。
translation: If someone also says, 'The Tathāgata is permanent, inexhaustible dharmas, and the ultimate support of all worlds,' they're also called a good explanation.

source_sentence: 是故能於無護世間無依世間與等後際，作無盡歸依、常住歸依、究竟歸依者，
translation: Therefore, they are able to act as inexhaustible refuges, eternally abiding refuges, and ultimately refuges at the end of the unprotected world.

source_sentence: 謂如來、應、正等覺。
translation: They are the Tathāgata, Arhat, and Completely Awakened One.

source_sentence: 法者是一乘道，僧者是三乘眾，此二歸依非究竟依，名少分依。
translation: The dharma is the path of the one-vehicle doctrine; samgha is the assembly of the three vehicles. These two forms of reliance are not the ultimate basis: they are called partial basis.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 說一乘道證究竟法身，於後更無說一乘道，三乘眾者有恐怖故；
translation: They teach the path of the one-vehicle doctrine and realize the ultimate body of reality. There is no later teaching of the path of the one-vehicle doctrine, because those in the three vehicles have fear.

source_sentence: 歸依如來求出修學，有所作故，向阿耨多羅三藐三菩提故。
translation: It's because they take refuge in the Tathāgata, seek out and cultivate it, and there's something to do, which leads to unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 二依非究竟依，是有限依。
translation: The second basis is not the ultimate basis: it is a limited basis.

source_sentence: 若諸有情如來調伏，歸依如來得法津潤，由信樂心歸依於法及比丘僧。
translation: If sentient beings are disciplined by the Tathāgata and rely on the Tathāgata to attain the Dharma that nourishes them, they will take refuge in the Dharma and the monks and nuns because of their faith and happiness.

source_sentence: 是二歸依，由法津潤信入歸依。
translation: These are the two refuges, which are based on the faith that flows from the Dharma and the faith that enters it.

source_sentence: 如來者非法津潤信入歸依，言如來者是真實依。
translation: The Tathāgata is an unlawful donor who nourishes faith and enters into refuge, saying that the Tathāgata is a true support.

source_sentence: 此二歸依以真實義，即名究竟歸依如來。
translation: Because of their true meaning, these two refuges are called the ultimate refuge of the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 如來不異此二歸依，是故如來即三歸依。
translation: The Tathāgata is no different from these two refuges; therefore, the Tathāgata is the same as the three refuges.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 說一乘道、如來最勝、具四無畏、正師子吼。
translation: He teaches the One Vehicle path, the supreme of the Tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, and the correct lion's roar.

source_sentence: 若諸如來隨彼所欲，而以方便說於二乘即是大乘。
translation: If the tathāgatas follow their desires and use skillful means to teach that the two vehicles are the great vehicle.

source_sentence: 以第一義無有二乘，二乘者同入一乘，一乘者即勝義乘。
translation: Because there are no two vehicles in the ultimate truth, those who enter the two vehicles all enter the one vehicle together, and the one vehicle is the ultimate vehicle.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 聲聞獨覺初證聖諦，非以一智斷諸住地，亦非一智證四遍知諸功德等，
translation: śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas first realize noble truths, not by one knowledge that they abandon the stages of abiding, nor by one knowledge that they realize the virtues of the four universal knowledges.

source_sentence: 亦非以法能善了知此四法義。
translation: Nor is it because of the Dharma that they can well understand the meaning of these four dharmas.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 於出世智，無有四智漸至漸緣。
translation: In supramundane cognition, there are no four kinds of gradually attained and gradually conditioned cognition.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 出世間智無漸至法，如金剛喻。
translation: supramundane cognition doesn't gradually reach the Dharma, just like the adamantine metaphor.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 聲聞獨覺以於種種聖諦之智斷諸住地，無有出世第一義智。
translation: śrāvakas and solitary realizers use the knowledge of various noble truths to end their entrenchments, but there's no supramundane cognition of the ultimate truth.

source_sentence: 唯有如來、應、正遍知，非諸聲聞獨覺境界，以不思議空性之智，能破一切諸煩惱[穀-禾+卵]。
translation: Only the Tathāgata, Arhat, and Perfectly Enlightened One can destroy all the afflictions [grass-grass+eggs] with the inconceivable wisdom of emptiness, which is not the sphere of śrāvakas or pratyekbuddhas.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 破煩惱[穀-禾+卵]究竟之智，是名出世第一義智。
translation: The ultimate wisdom that breaks through the afflictions [grass - grain + egg] is called supramundane cognition of the highest truth.

source_sentence: 初聖諦智非究竟智，是於趣向阿耨多羅三藐三菩提智。
translation: The first cognition of the noble truths is not ultimate cognition, which is the cognition that leads to unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 真聖義者即非二乘。
translation: The true and noble meaning is that it's not the two vehicles.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 聲聞獨覺唯能成就少分功德，名之為聖。
translation: śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas can only attain a small amount of merit, which is called noble.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 言聖諦者，非諸聲聞獨覺之諦及彼功德。
translation: The noble truths are not the truths of śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas or their merits.

source_sentence: 而此諦者，唯有如來、應、正等覺初始了知，然後為彼無明[穀-禾+卵]藏世間眾生開示演說，
translation: Only the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One understands this truth for the first time and then reveals it to sentient beings in the world who are born in the store of ignorance.

source_sentence: 故名聖諦。
translation: Therefore, it's called the noble truth.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此聖諦者，甚深微妙、難見難了、不可分別、非思量境，一切世間所不能信。
translation: This noble truth is so profound and subtle, difficult to see and difficult to understand, indescribable and not a perceptual object that all the world can't believe in.

source_sentence: 唯有如來、應、正等覺之所能知。
translation: Only the Tathāgata, Arhat, and Completely Awakened One can know it.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 此說甚深如來之藏。
translation: This is said to be the profound treasure house of the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 如來藏者是佛境界，非諸聲聞獨覺所行。
translation: The storehouse of the Tathāgata is the Buddha's sphere, which isn't practiced by śrāvakas or solitary realizers.

source_sentence: 於如來藏說聖諦義，此如來藏甚深微妙，所說聖諦亦復深妙，難見難了、不可分別、非思量境，
translation: The meaning of the holy truths taught in the treasury of enlightenment is profound and subtle in this treasury of enlightenment. The holy truths taught are also profound and subtle, difficult to see and difficult to understand, indescribable and inconceivable.

source_sentence: 一切世間所不能信，唯有如來、應、正等覺之所能知。
translation: Only the Tathāgata, Arhat, and Completely Awakened One can know this.

source_sentence: 若於無量煩惱所纏如來之藏不疑惑者，於出一切煩惱之藏如來法身亦無疑惑。
translation: If someone doesn't doubt the Tathāgata's store that's tethered by measureless afflictions, they also don't doubt the Tathāgata's Dharma body that emerges from the store of all afflictions.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若有於此如來之藏及佛法身不可思議佛祕密境心得究竟，於彼所說二聖諦義能信能了、能生勝解。
translation: If someone has the ultimate mind attainment of the inconceivable secret realm of the Tathāgata's store and the Buddha's Dharma body, then they can believe, comprehend, and give rise to a superior understanding of the meaning of the two noble truths explained there.

source_sentence: 何等名為二聖諦義？
translation: What are these two noble truths?

source_sentence: 所謂有作及以無作。
translation: It's called what's done and what's not done.

source_sentence: 作聖諦者，是不圓滿四聖諦義。
translation: Making the noble truths is the meaning of the four noble truths that are incomplete.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 由他護故，而不能得知一切苦、斷一切集、證一切滅、修一切道，是故不知有為無為及於涅槃。
translation: Because they are protected by others, they can't know all sufferings, end all accumulations, realize all cessations, and cultivate all paths; therefore, they don't know the conditioned and the unconditioned and nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 無作諦者，是說圓滿四聖諦義。
translation: The unmanifest truths are said to be the meaning of the accomplishment of the four noble truths.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 能自護故，知一切苦、斷一切集、證一切滅、修一切道。
translation: Because they can protect themselves, they know all suffering, end all accumulation, realize all cessation, and cultivate all paths.

source_sentence: 如是所說八聖諦義，如來但以四聖諦說。
translation: Thus, the Tathāgata explains the meaning of the eight noble truths only in terms of the four noble truths.

source_sentence: 於此無作四聖諦義，唯有如來、應、正等覺作事究竟，非阿羅漢及辟支佛力所能及。
translation: Only the Tathāgata, Arhat, and Completely Enlightened One are capable of accomplishing these unmanifest meanings of the four noble truths, and it's beyond the ability of arhats and pratyekabuddhas to do anything.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 非諸勝劣下中上法能證涅槃。
translation: It's not that the superior, inferior, lower, middle, and higher dharmas can realize nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 云何如來於無作諦得事究竟？
translation: How does the Tathāgata attain the end of things in the unconstructed truth?

source_sentence: 謂諸如來、應、正等覺，遍知諸苦，斷諸煩惱及超煩惱所攝苦集，能證一切意生身蘊所有苦滅，
translation: It means that the Buddhas, Arhats, and Fully Awakened Ones know all forms of suffering, eliminate afflictions, and transcend the accumulation of suffering included in afflictions. They are able to realize the cessation of all forms of suffering inherent in the mentally generated body aggregate.

source_sentence: 及修一切苦滅之道。
translation: He cultivates the path to the cessation of all suffering.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 非壞法故名為苦滅。
translation: It's not called the cessation of suffering because it doesn't destroy dharmas.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 言苦滅者，無始無作、無起無盡、常住不動、本性清淨、出煩惱[穀-禾+卵]。
translation: When it comes to the cessation of suffering, it's beginningless, unconstructed, unarisen, inexhaustible, eternally abiding, immovable, inherently pure, and free of affliction [grass-gras+eggs].

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如來成就過於恒沙，具解脫智不思議法，說名法身。
translation: The Tathāgata's accomplishment is beyond the extent of the Ganges River, and he possesses the inconceivable Dharma of liberating wisdom, which is said to be called the Dharma body.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如是法身不離煩惱，名如來藏。
translation: Thus, the Dharma body that isn't free of afflictions is called the tathāgatagarbha.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如來藏者，即是如來空性之智。
translation: The store of the Tathāgata is the knowledge of the emptiness of the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 如來藏者，一切聲聞獨覺所未曾見亦未曾得，唯佛了知及能作證。
translation: The treasury of the Tathāgata is something that all śrāvakas and solitary realizers have never seen or attained, but only buddhas know and can realize it.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此如來藏空性之智復有二種。
translation: Again, there are two kinds of cognition of the emptiness of this tathāgatagarbha.

source_sentence: 何等為二？
translation: What are these two?

source_sentence: 謂空如來藏，所謂離於不解脫智一切煩惱。
translation: It means the tathāgatagarbha of emptiness, which is called being free of all afflictions that aren't liberating from knowledge.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 不空如來藏具過恒沙佛解脫智不思議法。
translation: The nonempty tathāgatagarbha contains the inconceivable wisdom of the Buddha's liberation that surpasses the eternally abiding buddhas.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此二空智，諸大聲聞由信能入。
translation: These two kinds of cognition of emptiness are entered by the great śrāvakas through faith.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如是一切聲聞獨覺空性之智，於四倒境攀緣而轉，是故一切聲聞獨覺所未曾見亦未曾證。
translation: Thus, the knowledge of the emptiness of all śrāvakas and solitary realizers is conditioned by the four mistaken objects, so it's not seen or realized by all śrāvakas and solitary realizers.

source_sentence: 一切苦滅唯佛現證，壞諸煩惱修苦滅道。
translation: The cessation of all suffering is realized only by the Buddha, who destroys the afflictions and cultivates the path to suffering's cessation.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此四諦中，三諦無常，一諦是常。
translation: In these four truths, the three truths are impermanent, and one truth is permanent.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 如是三諦入有為相，有為相者則是無常。
translation: Thus, these three truths enter into conditioned characteristics, and conditioned characteristics are impermanent.

source_sentence: 言無常者是破壞法，破壞法者非諦非常非歸依處。
translation: The expression impermanent refers to the dharma that breaks down. A dharma that breaks down is neither a truth nor an eternal thing, and it is not a refuge.

source_sentence: 是故三諦以第一義非諦非常非歸依處。
translation: Therefore, the three truths take the first meaning as neither a truth nor an eternal nor a place of refuge.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 一苦滅諦離有為相，離有為相則性常住，性常住者非破壞法，非破壞者是諦是常、是歸依處。
translation: The one truth of suffering's cessation is free of conditioned characteristics, and being free of conditioned characteristics means that the nature is eternally abiding. Being eternally abiding by nature isn't a thing that breaks down, but what doesn't break down is a truth that's permanent and a refuge.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是故苦滅聖諦以勝義故，是諦是常是歸依處。
translation: Therefore, because of their ultimate meaning, the noble truth of suffering's cessation is a truth that's eternal and a refuge.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此苦滅諦是不思議，過諸有情心識境界，亦非一切聲聞獨覺智所能及。
translation: This truth of the cessation of suffering is inconceivable, beyond the realm of sentient beings' minds and consciousnesses, and it's beyond the ability of all śrāvakas and solitary realizers to know.

source_sentence: 譬如生盲不見眾色，七日嬰兒不見日輪。
translation: It's like being born blind and not seeing all forms, and a seven-day old child doesn't see the sun wheel.

source_sentence: 苦滅諦者亦復如是，非諸凡夫心識所緣，亦非一切聲聞獨覺智之境界。
translation: The truth of suffering's cessation is likewise, which isn't the perceptual object of ordinary people's minds and consciousnesses, and it's not the realm of the knowledge of all śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas.

source_sentence: 凡夫識者謂二邊見，一切聲聞獨覺智者名為淨智。
translation: Ordinary consciousness refers to two extreme views, and the knowledge of all śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas is called pure cognition.

source_sentence: 言邊見者，於五取蘊執著為我，生異分別。
translation: When it comes to extreme views, they cling to the five appropriating aggregates as self and give rise to different discriminations.

source_sentence: 邊見有二。
translation: There are two kinds of extreme views.

source_sentence: 何者為二？
translation: What are these two?

source_sentence: 所謂常見及以斷見。
translation: It's called the view of commonness and the view of elimination.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若復有見生死無常涅槃是常，非斷常見是名正見。
translation: If there's another view that birth-and-death is impermanent and nirvāṇa is permanent, but it's not stopped or constant, this is called right view.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 諸計度者見身諸根受者思者現法滅壞，於有相續不能了知，盲無慧目起於斷見。
translation: Those who conceptualize see the body as faculties, those who receive it and those who think about it cease and disintegrate in the present life, can't understand continuity of existence, and blind without the eye of wisdom they give rise to the view of cessation.

source_sentence: 於心相續剎那滅壞，愚闇不了意識境界，起於常見。
translation: When the mind ceases and disintegrates moment after moment in the stream, ignorance doesn't understand the consciousnesses as objects of consciousness, and it gives rise to perception.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 然彼彼義過諸分別及下劣見，由諸愚夫妄生異想顛倒執著，謂斷謂常。
translation: However, all these doctrines are free of discriminations and inferior views. Because foolish people falsely give rise to dissimilar conceptions and mistakenly cling to them, saying that they are abandoned and eternal.

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 顛倒有情於五取蘊，無常常想、苦為樂想、無我我想、不淨淨想。
translation: In the five appropriating aggregates, there's no perception of permanence, perception of suffering as pleasure, perception of selflessness as self, or perception of impurity as purity for mistaken sentient beings.

source_sentence: 聲聞獨覺所有淨智，於如來境及佛法身所未曾見。
translation: The pure knowledge possessed by śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas has never been seen in the Tathāgata's realm or in the Buddha's Dharma body.

source_sentence: 或有眾生信如來故，於如來所起於常想、樂想、我想及於淨想，非顛倒見即是正見。
translation: If there are sentient beings who believe in the Tathāgata and give rise to thoughts of permanence, happiness, self, and purity at the Tathāgata's place, they don't mistakenly see that right view as right view.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 如來法身是常波羅蜜、樂波羅蜜、我波羅蜜、淨波羅蜜。
translation: The Tathāgata's Dharma body is the perfection of permanence, the perfection of bliss, the perfection of self, and the perfection of purity.

source_sentence: 若諸有情作如是見是名正見，若正見者名真佛子，從佛口生、從正法生、從法化生、得佛法分。
translation: If sentient beings make such a view, this is called right view, and if they correctly see it, they're called truly the Buddha-child, which arises from the Buddha's mouth, arises from the right teaching, arises from the Dharma's transformation, and attains the Buddha's teaching.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 言淨智者，則是一切聲聞獨覺智波羅蜜。
translation: The term pure cognition refers to the perfection of the knowledge of all śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas.

source_sentence: 此之淨智，於苦滅諦尚非境界，況苦滅諦。
translation: This pure cognition is still not the objective realm for the truth of suffering's cessation, so why wouldn't it be for the truth of suffering's cessation?

source_sentence: 是四入流智之所行。
translation: It's the practice of the four kinds of entry-flow cognition.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 三乘初業不愚法者，能於彼義當證當了。
translation: Those in the first practice of the three vehicles who aren't ignorant of the teaching can realize and understand their meaning.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為何義故說四入流？
translation: What does it mean to say that the four streams of entry are spoken of?

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此四入流是世間法。
translation: These four inflows are worldly dharmas.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 唯一入流，於諸入流為最為上，以第一義是為入流、是為歸依、是苦滅諦。
translation: The only one that enters into the stream is the highest of all entering streams, because in the ultimate sense it's the entry into the stream, the refuge, and the truth of suffering's cessation.

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 生死者依如來藏，以如來藏故說前際不可了知。
translation: Birth-and-death is based on the tathāgatagarbha, and because of the tathāgatagarbha, it's said that the prior end can't be known.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 有如來藏故得有生死，是名善說。
translation: Because there's the tathāgatagarbha, birth-and-death can arise, which is called good explanation.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 生死者，諸受根滅無間相續未受根起，名為生死。
translation: Birth-and-death means that the sensation faculties cease without interruption and continue uninterruptedly, while the sensation faculties don't arise.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 生死二法是如來藏，於世俗法名為生死。
translation: The two dharmas of birth and death are the tathāgatagarbha, and they're called birth and death in worldly dharmas.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 死者諸受根滅，生者諸受根起，如來藏者則不生不死、不昇不墜、離有為相。
translation: Death is when the faculty of feeling ceases, birth is when the faculty of feeling arises, and the tathāgatagarbha is when it doesn't arise or die, doesn't ascend or fall, and parts with conditioned characteristics.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如來藏者常恒不壞，是故世尊！
translation: The treasury of the Tathāgata is eternal and indestructible; therefore, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如來藏者與不離解脫智藏是依是持，是為建立。
translation: The store of the Tathāgata and the store of wisdom that doesn't part from the store of liberation are bases and supports, which is establishment.

source_sentence: 亦與外離不解脫智諸有為法依持建立。
translation: It's also the support and establishment of conditioned dharmas that are free of non-liberated cognition from outside.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若無如來藏者，應無厭苦樂求涅槃。
translation: If someone doesn't have the tathāgatagarbha, they shouldn't tire of suffering and pleasure and seek nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 於此六識及以所知如是七法，剎那不住不受眾苦，不堪厭離願求涅槃。
translation: In these six consciousnesses and knowing such seven things, they don't abide momentarily or experience all kinds of suffering, aren't capable of distancing themselves from it, and wish to seek nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 如來藏者，無有前際無生無滅，法受諸苦。
translation: The treasury of the Tathāgata has no prior end, no birth or cessation, and dharmas experience suffering.

source_sentence: 彼為厭苦，願求涅槃。
translation: Because they are disgusted with suffering and wish to seek nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如來藏者，非有我人眾生壽者。
translation: The treasury of the Tathāgata is not a life span for self, humans, or sentient beings.

source_sentence: 如來藏者，身見有情、顛倒有情、空見有情，非所行境。
translation: The treasury of the Tathāgata refers to sentient beings who see their bodies, mistaken sentient beings, and sentient beings who see emptiness, which aren't objects that they practice.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如來藏者是法界藏，是法身藏、出世間藏、性清淨藏，此本性淨。
translation: The store of the Tathāgata is the store of the Dharma realm, which is the store of the Dharma body, the store that transcends the world, and the store that is inherently pure in nature, which is inherently pure.

source_sentence: 如來藏者如我所解，縱為客塵煩惱所染，猶是不可思議如來境界。
translation: The treasury of the Tathagata is as I understand it, and even if it's stained by guest afflictions, it's still the inconceivable realm of the Tathagata.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 剎那剎那善不善心客塵煩惱所不能染。
translation: moment-to-moment, moment-to-moment good and unskillful minds can't be stained by guest afflictions.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 煩惱不觸心，心不觸煩惱。
translation: The defilement doesn't touch the mind, and the mind doesn't touch the afflictions.

source_sentence: 云何不觸法而能得染心？
translation: How can a defiled mind be acquired without touching the Dharma?

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 由有煩惱有隨染心。
translation: It's because there are afflictions and subsequently defiled minds.

source_sentence: 隨煩惱染難解難了，唯佛世尊為眼、為智、為法根本、為尊、為導、為正法依，
translation: Only the Buddha, the Bhagavat, is the eye, knowledge, foundation of all things, honored one, guide, and support of the true doctrine.

source_sentence: 如實知見。」
translation: They truly know and see.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊歎勝鬘夫人言：「善哉善哉，如汝所說。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān praised Lady Śrīmālā, saying, Good, good, as you said.

source_sentence: 性清淨心隨煩惱染，難可了知。
translation: The mind that's inherently pure and defiled by afflictions is difficult to fathom.

source_sentence: 復次勝鬘！
translation: Furthermore, Vaiśravaṇa!

source_sentence: 有二種法難可了知。
translation: There are two kinds of dharmas that are difficult to understand.

source_sentence: 何等為二？
translation: What are these two?

source_sentence: 謂性清淨心難可了知，彼心為煩惱染亦難了知。
translation: It means that it's difficult to know the mind that's inherently pure, and it's also difficult to know when that mind is defiled by afflictions.

source_sentence: 如此二法，汝及成就大法菩薩乃能聽受，諸餘聲聞由信能解。
translation: You and the bodhisattvas who have perfected the great teaching are able to hear and accept these two things, and the other śrāvakas can understand them by faith.

source_sentence: 勝鬘！
translation: Vaiśravaṇa!

source_sentence: 若我弟子增上信者，隨順法智，於此法中而得究竟。
translation: If my disciple has increased faith, he'll follow the knowledge of the teaching and attain its ultimate realization in this teaching.

source_sentence: 順法智者，觀根識境，觀察業報，觀羅漢眠觀心自在愛樂禪樂，觀聲聞獨覺聖神變通。
translation: Consistent with knowledge of the Dharma, he observes the faculties, consciousnesses, and objects, observes the results of actions, observes the arhat's sleep, observes his mind freely, loves meditation and happiness, and observes the noble miraculous powers of śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas.

source_sentence: 由成就此五善巧觀，現在未來聲聞弟子因增上信隨順法智，善能解了性清淨心煩惱所染而得究竟。
translation: By accomplishing these five skillful contemplations, the śrāvaka disciples of the present and future who will become śrāvakas because of their increasing faith and following the knowledge of the Dharma will be able to understand well that they are inherently pure, stained by mental afflictions and attaining their ultimate attainment.

source_sentence: 勝鬘！
translation: Vaiśravaṇa!

source_sentence: 是究竟者為大乘因。
translation: The ultimate is the cause of the great vehicle.

source_sentence: 汝今當知信如來者，於甚深法不生誹謗。」
translation: Now, you should know that someone who believes in the Tathāgata doesn't denigrate the profound teaching.

source_sentence: 爾時勝鬘夫人白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that Lady Śrīmālā said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 復有餘義能多利益。
translation: Furthermore, there are other meanings that can often bring benefit.

source_sentence: 我當承佛威神之力，演說斯事。」
translation: I will inherit the Buddha's authoritative power to explain these things.

source_sentence: 佛言：「善哉。
translation: The Buddha said, Good!

source_sentence: 今恣汝說。」
translation: Now, I'll explain it to you freely.

source_sentence: 勝鬘夫人言：「有三種善男子善女人，於甚深法離自毀傷，生多功德入大乘道。
translation: Lady Śrīmālā said, There are three kinds of good men and good women who part with self- disparagement about the profound Dharma and produce much merit to enter the great vehicle path.

source_sentence: 何等為三？
translation: What are these three?

source_sentence: 若善男子善女人等，能自成就甚深法智，或有成就隨順法智，或有於此甚深法中不能解了，
translation: “Good sons and good daughters, if they themselves have attained profound knowledge of the teaching, some will attain knowledge conforming to the teaching; some will not be able to understand this profound teaching.

source_sentence: 仰推如來，唯佛所知非我境界。
translation: I respectfully presume that the Tathāgata is known only by buddhas and not by self.

source_sentence: 除此三種善男子善女人已，諸餘有情於甚深法，隨己所取執著妄說，違背正法習諸外道。
translation: In addition to these three kinds of good men and good women, the other sentient beings follow their own grasping and clinging to what's so profound that they falsely explain it in ways that are contrary to the right teaching and accustomed to non-Buddhist views.

source_sentence: 腐敗種子，設在餘方應往除滅。
translation: If the rotten seeds are elsewhere, they should go there to remove them.

source_sentence: 彼腐敗者，一切天人應共摧伏。」
translation: Those who are rotten should be destroyed by all gods and humans together.

source_sentence: 勝鬘夫人說是語已，與諸眷屬頂禮佛足。
translation: After speaking these words, Lady Śrīmālā and her retinues bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet.

source_sentence: 時佛世尊讚言：「善哉。
translation: The Bhagavān then praised him, saying, Good!

source_sentence: 勝鬘！
translation: Vaiśravaṇa!

source_sentence: 於甚深法方便守護，降伏怨敵善能通達。
translation: He skillfully guards the profound Dharma, subdues enemies, and is well able to comprehend it.

source_sentence: 汝已親近百千俱胝諸佛如來，能說此義。」
translation: You've already become intimate with hundreds of thousands of koṭis of buddha-tathāgatas who can explain this meaning.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊放勝光明普照大眾，身昇虛空高七多羅量，以神通力足步虛空還舍衛城。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān radiated a superior light that shone universally on the masses, rose seven-thousand feet high into space with his body and returned to Śrāvastī by footsteps of supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 時勝鬘夫人與諸眷屬，瞻仰世尊目不暫捨，過眼境已歡喜踊躍，遞共稱歎如來功德，
translation: Lady Śrīmālā and the members of her retinue then looked up at the World-honored One with their eyes fixed on him, did not let go of him for a moment, passed beyond the range of his eyes, and jumped in joy. They all praised the virtues of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 一心念佛還無鬪城，勸友稱王建立大乘。
translation: With one mindful thought of the Buddha, he returned to the city of no fighting and encouraged friends to call themselves kings to establish the great vehicle.

source_sentence: 城中女人七歲已上化以大乘，友稱大王亦以大乘化諸男子七歲已上，舉國人民無不學者。
translation: The women in the city were transformed by the great vehicle when they were seven years old, and the friend named the great king also transformed men seven years old and older by the great vehicle, so all the people of the country didn't fail to study it.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊入逝多林，告尊者阿難及念天帝。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān entered the Jeta grove and addressed Venerable Ānanda and Indra Mindful.
